page.title: 05ECOLOGY
page.content: The area is typical of Shropshire Plain farming country. Although some hedgerows have been destroyed because of financial inentives offered, many remain to contribute to the insect, animal and bird life, which is richly varied. The compromise between financial expediency and conservation also applies to the retention of coppice, woodlands and standard - usually deciduous - trees. Crop-spraying does cause some pollution. The river has also been polluted by a discharge of pig slurry but it is now recovering. The climate generally is moderate but very low temperatures are sometimes recorded during Winter and heavy snowfalls are not uncommon.
